nodes.bodyText: In this root build.gradle I believe we should only define ext versions we want to share between more than 1 build.gradle file. Example jUnitVersion doesn't need to be here since it will only ever be used in the unittest project.
Ok I divided on different ext, but kept the definition of the variables just for coding convention
Let me know what you think
I like it, looks good to me!

I think we should be more specific on this one.
Can we call it googleServicesGradlePluginVersion?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,36 +1,45 @@
 // Top-level build file where you can add configuration options common to all sub-projects/modules.
 
 buildscript {
-    ext.kotlin_version = '1.3.72'
+
+    ext {
+        buildVersions = [
+                compileSdkVersion: 28,
+                targetSdkVersion: 28
+        ]
+        googleServicesVersion = '4.3.2'

nodes.bodyText: This is being used for com.android.tools.build:gradle so we should call it androidGradlePluginVersion.

I think we should be more specific on this one.
Can we call it huaweiAgconnectVersion?
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -1,36 +1,45 @@
 // Top-level build file where you can add configuration options common to all sub-projects/modules.
 
 buildscript {
-    ext.kotlin_version = '1.3.72'
+
+    ext {
+        buildVersions = [

+        gradleVersion = '3.6.2'
+        huaweiHMSPushVersion = '4.0.2.300'
+        huaweiHMSLocationVersion = '4.0.0.300'
+        huaweiVersion = '1.2.1.301'
